thread.title: NFL pulls credentials from Barstool Sports
thread.title_full: NFL pulls credentials from Barstool Sports

author: Michael David Smith
title: NFL pulls credentials from Barstool Sports
text:
Jan 31, 2017 9:01 AM 
Less Media shills and more Media that is not following the usual agenda. dsigrey says: Jan 31, 2017 9:02 AM 
Roger can’t have any conflicts you know. God forbid someone not stick to the script and actually ask a tough question. Jan 31, 2017 9:03 AM 
Pres wearing “Fire Goodell” shirt on the rundown last night probably didn’t help osiris33 (bandwagon since 1976) says: Jan 31, 2017 9:04 AM 
The Ideal Gas “Law” is FakeScience, so I don’t blame the NFL. weepingjebus says: Jan 31, 2017 9:05 AM 
Release the psi data immediately. JSpicoli says: Jan 31, 2017 9:05 AM 
NFL taking lessons from the DNC. Jan 31, 2017 9:07 AM 
Goodell taking a page right out of the Trump playbook? They deserve each other. carloswlassiter says: Jan 31, 2017 9:09 AM 
If everyone who hates Goodell has their credentials pulled, we can just start SB week on Sunday afternoon. wryly1 says: Jan 31, 2017 9:09 AM 
Speaking only for myself, I’m okay with media outlets that are staffed by trained professional journalists – in sports, news, business, entertainment, or any other field. Jan 31, 2017 9:09 AM 
And this surprises who? 
Godell can do whatever he wants to do 2 dopey judges in NU said so Jan 31, 2017 9:11 AM 
Barstool is great. A smart person learns to take them in stride. 
Sticking it to Goodell should be a new sport league! 
Freedom of the press above must be above 345 Park ave. factschecker says: Jan 31, 2017 9:12 AM 
I miss the old media. Not just the old football media but the regular media too. 
In the old days 
Here is the news………Over here, if you want them, we might have some opinions about said news. 
These days they are blended up into being the same thing. I just want the news and that’s it. I’m fully capable of thinking about the topic and forming my own opinion all on my own. Now days even “the facts” are highly debatable. nufcedmcgreevey says: Jan 31, 2017 9:13 AM 
Good ell, the emporer with no clothes, is as corrupt and un American as they come. Indybear says: Jan 31, 2017 9:13 AM 
We need more people protesting Goodell for whatever reason and there are many from which to choose. redeemerac says: Jan 31, 2017 9:14 AM 
I hate the Patriots….but want them to win it even more now…just to see Goodell hand over that Trophy! Jan 31, 2017 9:15 AM 
This committee owes an apology — apology, Commissioner Jan 31, 2017 9:15 AM 
Imagine that ….The NFL would never do anything illegal………..smh Jan 31, 2017 9:16 AM 
SALT OF THE EARTH Jan 31, 2017 9:17 AM 
looks like portnoy and his buddies got busted, but that will not stop them. 
it has been hilarious watching them confront the arrogant, obnoxious and jealous losers who have the agenda against the pats. 
people like marshall faulk and other former players who sit there and lie and act all butthurt because they lost a big game to the better team 10+ years ago, was priceless to watch 
goodell using fascist censorship in this case, makes them look worse San Diego Sportswire says: Jan 31, 2017 9:18 AM 
Goodell is such a crony. The league is going to continue its downward spiral of ratings and attendance and cities are not going to allow the NFL to use their names outside of their city limits any longer. 
It is kind of ironic that the league’s ratings are dropping universally but they are limiting access. Very Trumpesque! Jan 31, 2017 9:19 AM 
The NFL giving Barstool outlaw status is a blessing to Portnoy. bullcharger says: Jan 31, 2017 9:22 AM 
When I became an NFL fan as a kid is was to watch great athletes play a great sport. I didn’t care about who the commissioner was. I still don’t care. Goodell should not be such an important figure in the NFL from a fans perspective. He should be almost invisible. Jan 31, 2017 9:24 AM 
osiris33 (bandwagon since 1976) says: Jan 31, 2017 9:04 AM The Ideal Gas “Law” is FakeScience, so I don’t blame the NFL. 
just so you know, even the people hired to nail the Pats would disagree with you 
think about that Jan 31, 2017 9:26 AM 
First they came for the Saints, and I said nothing… Then they came for Brady, and i said nothing (not really) … Then they came for the pot smokers, and i said nothing … Then they came for Barstool, and i said nothing … Now they have come for me, and there is no one left to say anything 
way to go goodell, another notch in your belt… crookedstick says: Jan 31, 2017 9:27 AM 
By doing this, the NFL just provided Barstool way more exposure and promotion than if they’d just ignored them. I hadn’t even heard of them until this, but will definitely give them some clicks. Brilliant PR move once again NFL! harrisonhits2 says: Jan 31, 2017 9:27 AM 
“The Ideal Gas “Law” is FakeScience, so I don’t blame the NFL.” 
Double facepalm. 
I advise you go buy yourself an official NFL football. Included in the instructions is a statement that the ball can lose pressure in cold weather. 
Not to mention that all over the country in cold weather states, people have been getting low tire pressure alerts due to, you got it, cold weather. Mine has been coming on every 2 weeks like clockwork. 
The only thing fake is the league manufacturing deflategate. You show only how poorly educated you are with that statement. mjsully123 says: Jan 31, 2017 9:28 AM 
Ray Lewis going to be there? Got forbid they ban people for a “sit-in” at NFL headquarters, but allow someone who, more probable than not, hindered a murder investigation. Jan 31, 2017 9:34 AM 
lscottman3 says: Jan 31, 2017 9:09 AM And this surprises who? 
Godell can do whatever he wants to do 2 dopey judges in NU said so 
- 
The two judges were right though. Their job was to interpret the CBA that the dopey NFLPA signed off on. patsfan says: Jan 31, 2017 9:34 AM 
Free Portnoy! twinfan24 says: Jan 31, 2017 9:37 AM 
So, if they had protested the offices, and then left before getting arrested, would that have been OK? maust1013 says: Jan 31, 2017 9:38 AM 
So, to be clear, a league that previously lets a ‘sports journalist’ wander around media day in a wedding dress and ask a starting QB if he will marry her pulled credentials from one of the webs fastest growing sites for a key demographic? Because some of the their employees were arrested during a peaceful sit in almost 2 years ago? But that site had credentials last year when NE wasn’t in the SB? But it’s about that May 2015 arrest and not the Fire Goodell shirt one of them was wearing on radio row? Seems legit… SupZo! says: Jan 31, 2017 9:41 AM 
Ironic the credentials were pulled in time to prevent them from appearing on radio row…they protested the “Commissioner in Chief” aver a year ago… Jan 31, 2017 9:51 AM 
greenlargo 
The two judges were right though. Their job was to interpret the CBA that the dopey NFLPA signed off on.
